intro: Cyclosorus acutissimus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water fern, is a member of the family Marsileaceae. It is a small, aquatic plant characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are divided into four parts, resembling a cloverleaf. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in ponds and ditches. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically submerged. Cyclosorus acutissimus plays a role in water filtration and provides habitat for small aquatic organisms.
